title: Consolidate artifact and backend URI naming

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

labels.name: priority/awaiting-more-evidence
labels.description: Lowest priority. Possibly useful, but not yet enough support to actually get it done.

body:
Although it is described in various pages of the documentation, it is confusing and difficult to figure out where things will be stored.
In my opinion, this is due to:
1. different names for the same things, e.g., artifact_uri, artifact_location, artifact-root (there is also artifact_path which means something else)
2. the fact that experiment settings in backend store override artifact_uri

Since I am just starting with mlflow there may be other reasons I am not aware of, but it seems to me that tracking_uri and artifact_uri explicitly set by the user would suffice. This could be either with `mlflow.set_*_uri()` methods, `MLFLOW_*_URI` env. vars or parameters passed to the server.

### Examples
#### Artifacts
mlflow.get_artifact_uri()
mlflow.log_artifacts(local_dir, artifact_path=None)
mlflow.create_experiment(name, artifact_location=None)
--default-artifact-root
--artifact-uri

#### Backend
--backend-store-uri
MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI
mlflow.set_tracking_uri
